column4: Hi all. I have a very weird problem.  Grub is not booting. All I get is a black screen with a blinking cursor. I went into the recovery mode of my alternative live CD and was able to see my HD and files. I then did a rub install but that did not work either.
Grub install*
Also, I am talking from a tablet. Input is slow
what video chip do you use?
what video chip does the system use?
not sure. But I did not update that...
I will check
does the system have a make and model?
HP pavilion hpe-210f
is the Ubuntu OS installed in virtualbox or actually on the system?
radon HD 5450
trying to chroot and start x
interesting. It looks like it is mounted read only
sounds like you need an fsck to make sure its healthy
how can I tell if it is read only or not?
run:   mount    and it will say
nm not to
I will load gparted and fsck. Want me to keep you updated?
fsck was done in a sec
am I using it right?
ah. Found it. e2fsck -cvf
I think I am looking in the wrong place. Not even grub boots...
